description: 2020 JUN 05-- By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Network Daily News-- Research findings on Networks- Neural Networks are discussed in a new report. Funders for this research include National Natural Science Foundation of China, Australian Research Council, Research Grants Council, University Grants Committee, China Post-Doctoral Science Foundation.
text:
2020 JUN 05 (NewsRx) -- By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Network Daily
News \-- Research findings on Networks - Neural Networks are discussed in a
new report. According to news reporting from Jinhua, People's Republic of
China, by NewsRx journalists, research stated, "Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)
have become a topic of intense research recently due to their powerful
capability in high-dimensional classification and regression tasks for graph-
structured data. However, as GNNs typically define the graph convolution by
the orthonormal basis for the graph Laplacian, they suffer from high
computational cost when the graph size is large."

Funders for this research include National Natural Science Foundation of
China, Australian Research Council, Research Grants Council, University Grants
Committee, China Post-Doctoral Science Foundation.

The news correspondents obtained a quote from the research from Zhejiang
Normal University, "This paper introduces a Haar basis, which is a sparse and
localized orthonormal system for a coarse-grained chain on the graph. The
graph convolution under Haar basis, called Haar convolution, can be defined
accordingly for GNNs. The sparsity and locality of the Haar basis allow Fast
Haar Transforms (FHTs) on the graph, by which one then achieves a fast
evaluation of Haar convolution between graph data and filters."

According to the news reporters, the research concluded: "We conduct
experiments on GNNs equipped with Haar convolution, which demonstrates state-
of-the-art results on graph-based regression and node classification tasks."

For more information on this research see: Fast Haar Transforms for Graph
Neural Networks. _Neural Networks_ , 2020;128():188-198. (Elsevier \-
[www.elsevier.com](http://www.elsevier.com); Neural Networks -
<http://www.journals.elsevier.com/neural-networks/>)

Our news journalists report that additional information may be obtained by
contacting M. Li, Dept. of Educational Technology, Zhejiang Normal University,
Jinhua, People's Republic of China. Additional authors for this research
include Z. Ma, Y.G. Wang and X. Zhuang.

The direct object identifier (DOI) for that additional information is:
<https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neunet.2020.04.028>. This DOI is a link to an
online electronic document that is either free or for purchase, and can be
your direct source for a journal article and its citation.

(Our reports deliver fact-based news of research and discoveries from around
the world.)

title: New Neural Networks Study Findings Have Been Reported by Researchers at Zhejiang Normal University (Fast Haar Transforms for Graph Neural Networks): Networks - Neural Networks
html:
2020 JUN 05 (NewsRx) -- By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Network Daily News -- Research findings on Networks - Neural Networks are discussed in a new report. According to news reporting from Jinhua, People’s Republic of China, by NewsRx journalists, research stated, “Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have become a topic of intense research recently due to their powerful capability in high-dimensional classification and regression tasks for graph-structured data. However, as GNNs typically define the graph convolution by the orthonormal basis for the graph Laplacian, they suffer from high computational cost when the graph size is large.”

Funders for this research include National Natural Science Foundation of China, Australian Research Council, Research Grants Council, University Grants Committee, China Post-Doctoral Science Foundation.

The news correspondents obtained a quote from the research from Zhejiang Normal University, “This paper introduces a Haar basis, which is a sparse and localized orthonormal system for a coarse-grained chain on the graph. The graph convolution under Haar basis, called Haar convolution, can be defined accordingly for GNNs. The sparsity and locality of the Haar basis allow Fast Haar Transforms (FHTs) on the graph, by which one then achieves a fast evaluation of Haar convolution between graph data and filters.”

According to the news reporters, the research concluded: “We conduct experiments on GNNs equipped with Haar convolution, which demonstrates state-of-the-art results on graph-based regression and node classification tasks.”

For more information on this research see: Fast Haar Transforms for Graph Neural Networks. Neural Networks, 2020;128():188-198. (Elsevier - www.elsevier.com; Neural Networks - http://www.journals.elsevier.com/neural-networks/)

Our news journalists report that additional information may be obtained by contacting M. Li, Dept. of Educational Technology, Zhejiang Normal University, Jinhua, People’s Republic of China. Additional authors for this research include Z. Ma, Y.G. Wang and X. Zhuang.

The direct object identifier (DOI) for that additional information is: https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neunet.2020.04.028. This DOI is a link to an online electronic document that is either free or for purchase, and can be your direct source for a journal article and its citation.

(Our reports deliver fact-based news of research and discoveries from around the world.)
